executive_summary: Over the past five years, the Print Advertising Distribution industry has contracted alongside the relevance of print advertising. Expenditure on print advertising has declined during the period as digital advertising has taken over. In 2020, COVID-19 exacerbated this trend, further pushing consumers to shop, work and socialize online. Additionally, the overall macroeconomic decline associated with the coronavirus led to reductions in consumer spending and corporate profit, contributing to a decline in total advertising expenditure. Overall, IBISWorld estimates industry revenue has decreased an annualized 1.5% to $3.9 billion over the five years to 2023, including an expected 0.3% decline in 2023 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Promotional Samples Distribution is the Industry's Main Revenue Source
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Promotional sample distribution has been the largest source of revenue for the industry as the distribution of print advertising has declined in popularity.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Promotional Advertising Activity Has Grown During the Period
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A recent consumer survey notes the untapped potential of product sampling as part of businesses' marketing strategies.
Promotional sample distribution, however, requires substantial upfront investment relative to print, digital and TV ads.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Print Advertising Has Been the Most Vulnerable to the Rise in Digital Advertising
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies are increasingly choosing digital advertising for their marketing needs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: As Print Media Readership Declines, Demand for Print Advertising and Distribution Also Declines
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Print advertising has captured a large share of total advertising expenditure due to its low cost.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Despite the negative trends, industry participation has increased
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: New entrants are eager to utilize the growing promotional samples distribution segment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Advertising will remain crucial to the industry's growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Print Advertising Will Fall Short Despite Increases in Total Advertising Expenditure
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A crucial downfall of print advertising is its inability to target an audience with the same accuracy as digital advertisements.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: PROMOTIONAL PRODUCTS AND SAMPLES WILL REMAIN AN OPPORTUNITY FOR THE INDUSTRY GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Promotional distribution involves distributing company products to events and influencers.

industry_definition: This industry directly distributes and delivers advertisements (e.g. circulars, coupons and handbills) and samples.
key_trends: Declining demand for print advertising due to rise of digital advertising
Growth in promotional product sampling and distribution
Increasing industry participation despite overall decline

products_and_services.product_or_service: Distribution of Ad Materials in Other Locations
products_and_services.product_description: Since the majority of advertising activities are conducted per specific client requests.
Door-to-door distribution includes the distribution of flyers.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Distribution of Ad Materials in Public Locations
products_and_services.product_description: Advertising distribution companies distribute advertising materials in public locations.

tier_1_suppliers: Office Stationery Manufacturing in the US
Long-Distance Freight Trucking in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Coated & Laminated Paper Manufacturing in the US

New Car Dealers in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Door-to-Door Distribution Has Been Unfavored by Customers
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment's revenue share has declined as these advertising methods have become perceived as wasteful.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Public Location Distribution Declined Significantly During COVID-19
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment fell as a share of industry revenue in 2020 due to COVID-19.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Distribution of Advertising Materials in Other Locations Represents the Industry's Most Common Service
demand_determinants.determinant_description: In addition to distributing advertising materials, industry companies also offer brand representation services.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region, representing 31.9% of the national population, accounts for 25.8% of industry establishments.
Like the Southeast, the West and Mid-Atlantic regions also hold large concentrations.
Like the Southeast, the West and Mid-Atlantic regions also hold large concentrations.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Distributors must respect private property laws.
COVID-19 prompted the implementation of health and safety protocols.

basis_points.basis_description: Industry players have invested heavily in skilled labor.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry has a low market share concentration.
The top four companies command less than 40.0% of industry revenue.
The industry's high fragmentation is due to the localized nature.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit has fallen during the period
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As the industry's largest cost component, fluctuations in wage expenditure can be a significant determining factor.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs among companies vary due to the fragmented nature of the industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In the case of larger companies, purchases may include delivery vehicles.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The degree of capital intensity is generally low for the industry.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The industry has a low revenue volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry has consistently trended downward.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue fluctuations can also come from changes in demand from key markets
volatility_points.volatility_description: For example, declines in the Wireless Telecommunications Carriers industry.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Door-to-door distribution has been unfavored by customers
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Door-to-door distribution includes the distribution of flyers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Public Location Distribution Declined Significantly During COVID-19
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Advertising distribution companies distribute advertising materials in public locations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The Distribution of Advertising Materials in Other Locations Represents the Industry's Most Common Service
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The distribution of advertising materials typically varies beyond simple print advertisements.

FAQs.question: How have economic changes influenced consumer demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: When economic times are good with low unemployment, demand for advertising services increases.

FAQs.question: Have shifting consumer preferences presented an opportunity/threat to your company's growth prospects?
FAQs.answer: Digital advertising has been the primary source of competition.

FAQs.question: How has your company minimized costs?
FAQs.answer: Ad distributors can minimize costs by hiring independent contractors.

FAQs.question: Has your company pursued merger and acquisition strategies to gain market share and improve efficiencies?
FAQs.answer: Since profit is decreasing and the industry declining, companies will likely need to consolidate costs.

FAQs.question: Have investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Demographic databases and online marketing technologies could aid operators.

FAQs.question: Over the past five years, has the regulatory environment changed significantly?
FAQs.answer: The regulatory environment has remained stable.

FAQs.question: Does your company benefit from any government legislation?
FAQs.answer: Distributors may lose more ad market share from the implications of the Net Neutrality bill.

FAQs.question: How has your company's profitability trended over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Profit increased over the past five years, but profit margins are volatile year-to-year.

FAQs.question: Is your company looking to significantly expand its operations sometime in the near future?
FAQs.answer: Companies should expand into promotional sample distribution.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain product quality?
FAQs.answer: Quality control includes ensuring products are delivered to the right place at the right time.

FAQs.question: How does your coverage compare with that of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Effectively offering services across several geographic areas better suits clients' needs.

FAQs.question: Do you have large contracts in comparison to your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Having a large supply contract and several regular weekly distribution clients increases revenue.

FAQs.question: How does your company position itself for future growth?
FAQs.answer: Although performance varies, this industry's performance relies largely on print advertising expenditure.

FAQs.question: Does online advertising pose a direct competitive source for your company?
FAQs.answer: Internet traffic volume represents competition as internet media becomes more prevalent.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor advertising expenditure?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators should closely monitor advertising expenditure.

FAQs.question: Does revenue for your company tend to fluctuate in line with total advertising expenditure?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators should closely monitor total advertising expenditure.
